name: Pillars Fund
mission: Pillars Fund amplifies the leadership, narratives, and talents of Muslims in the United States to advance opportunity and justice for all.
theoryOfChange: Pillars Fund explicitly states its mission to "amplify the leadership, narratives, and talents of Muslims in the United States to advance opportunity and justice for all." They are focused on "narrative and cultural power — tapping into a rich inheritance of Muslim storytelling to transform society." This approach is further detailed as a "long-term narrative and culture change strategy for and with the American Muslim community." Their work involves supporting nonprofit organizations and creative leaders who are building narrative and cultural power for social change, and they have initiatives like the Pillars Artist Fellowship to empower creatives to tell their own stories. This demonstrates a clear, documented program strategy linking their activities to their overarching goals and desired impact.
zakatClaimEvidence: Pillars Fund is described as a grant-making organization and Muslim community foundation focused on funding secular non-profit programs supporting American Muslims. There is no explicit mention on their website or in the provided search results that they accept zakat donations from individuals or have dedicated zakat funds. (Source: https://pillarsfund.secure.nonprofitsoapbox.com/donate-to-pillars-fund)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5)
components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 25/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; moderate program ratio (≥65%)
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.
components.name: Financial Health

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Pillars Fund shows strong impact and moderate alignment (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Pillars Fund is described as a grant-making organization and Muslim community foundation focused on funding secular non-profit programs supporting American Muslims. There is no explicit mention on their website or in the provided search results that they accept zakat donations from individuals or have dedicated zakat funds. (Source: https://pillarsfund.secure.nonprofitsoapbox.com/donate-to-pillars-fund)

all_citations.claim: The organization reports a program expense ratio of 74.3%, working capital of 20.7 months, and a fundraising efficiency of $0.31 per $1 raised.
Pillars Fund reported a total revenue of $2,398,957.
Pillars Fund strategically supports nonprofit organizations that amplify the talents of American Muslims.
The organization supports fellows through the Pillars Artist Fellowship and MNC cohorts.
The organization tracks outcomes related to multimedia contributions and storytelling grants.
The organization provides options for general charitable giving and sadaqah.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 64/100 score due to its high program directness and solid financial reserves, though its overall score is moderated by fundraising costs and a medium alignment for specific donor segments.
areas_for_improvement: Fundraising efficiency of $0.31 per $1 raised suggests higher-than-average costs to acquire new funding [1]
Limited public data regarding specific long-term cost-per-beneficiary metrics [1]

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization offers a medium fit for donors interested in religious and cultural advocacy, specifically providing pathways for sadaqah-eligible giving [6]. While it maintains a clear track record in the storytelling and nonprofit sectors, the urgency is categorized as cultural-religious rather than emergency-based [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: Pillars Fund demonstrates high effectiveness in capacity building, investing 74.3% of its expenses into its core programs [1][2]. The organization has successfully leveraged funds to support multimedia contributions and cohorts of fellows, maintaining a strong financial cushion of 20.7 months of working capital [3][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: Pillars Fund empowers American Muslim communities by strategically investing in storytelling and leadership to reshape cultural narratives.
strengths: Strong program expense ratio of 74.3%, indicating a majority of funds go directly to initiatives [1]
Robust liquidity with 20.7 months of working capital available to sustain operations [1]
Strategic focus on high-impact cultural sectors through the Pillars Artist Fellowship [4]
baseline_narrative.summary: Pillars Fund is a nonprofit organization dedicated to strengthening relations between American Muslims and the broader public by amplifying Muslim talents and leadership [3]. Through initiatives like the Pillars Artist Fellowship and Storytelling Grants, the organization provides critical resources to creators and nonprofit leaders [4][5]. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported a total revenue of $2,398,957 [2].

all_citations.claim: 6 Fellows supported in its MNC cohort

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 64/100 score due to its high program directness and solid financial reserves, though its overall score is moderated by fundraising costs and a medium alignment for specific donor segments.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization currently spends <cite id="8">$0.31 per $1 raised</cite>, which suggests higher-than-average costs to acquire new funding.
Financial data indicates a <cite id="7">-53.4% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>, highlighting a need for diversified and stabilized funding streams.

bbb_assessment.summary: BBB Wise Giving Alliance assessment data is not available for this organization.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains substantial working capital reserves to offset revenue fluctuations.
risk_factors: The organization experienced a <cite id="7">-53.4% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>.
Fundraising costs are relatively high at <cite id="8">$0.31 per $1 raised</cite>.
case_against.summary: The primary concerns for donors involve recent revenue contraction and fundraising costs.

confidence.notes: Financial data is robust, but impact metrics are limited to high-level outputs.

alignment.explanation: The organization provides a medium fit for Muslim donors focused on religious and cultural causes, operating entirely within the sadaqah-eligible space.
alignment.improvement: Add a dedicated page clearly stating the organization's funding policies and sadaqah guidelines.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its transparent reporting, evidenced by its Bronze Seal of Transparency from Candid, and its strong governance structure featuring <cite id="9">9 board members</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the organization could publish more detailed annual impact reports with specific beneficiary counts.

impact.explanation: Operations show a highly efficient <cite id="2">74.3% program expense ratio</cite> and strong financial health with <cite id="6">20.7 months of working capital</cite>.
impact.improvement: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Some outcome tracking available

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Provides fellowships and storytelling grants to individuals and organizations.

rich_narrative.headline: Pillars Fund empowers American Muslim communities by strategically investing in storytelling and leadership to reshape cultural narratives.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to invest in long-term cultural narrative change and support American Muslim representation in media and the arts.
donor_motivations: Care deeply about American Muslim representation in mainstream media
Value capacity building and leadership development
Prefer supporting systemic cultural change over direct emergency relief
giving_considerations: Donations support capacity building and fellowships rather than direct humanitarian aid
Impact is measured in cultural influence and leveraged funds rather than lives saved
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill specific religious obligations or those looking for direct humanitarian relief and emergency aid programs.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C indicates that the organization tracks basic output metrics, such as fellowships awarded and funds leveraged, but lacks rigorous third-party impact evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Pillars Fund creates impact by investing in Muslim artists and leaders to reshape public narratives.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence helps ensure donations create real impact and that cultural interventions effectively shift public perception.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The organization has experienced recent revenue contraction but maintains strong reserves, indicating capacity to absorb and deploy new funding effectively.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its specific focus on American Muslim narratives and its ability to leverage <cite id="3">$30,000,000 in funds</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: More focus on direct community organizing and health services
similar_organizations.name: Inner-City Muslim Action Network (IMAN)

similar_organizations.differentiator: More focus on policy advocacy and government relations
similar_organizations.name: Muslim Public Affairs Council (MPAC)

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="2">74.3% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring the vast majority of funding directly supports its cultural and storytelling initiatives.
Pillars Fund holds <cite id="6">20.7 months of working capital</cite>, providing significant stability and the ability to weather funding fluctuations.
The organization has successfully catalyzed broader support, with <cite id="3">$30,000,000 in funds invested and leveraged</cite> for its mission.

strengths_deep_dive: Pillars Fund demonstrates strong operational efficiency and financial stability. The organization's commitment to its mission is evident in its <cite id="2">74.3% program expense ratio</cite>, which maximizes the impact of donor contributions. Furthermore, the organization's financial health is bolstered by <cite id="6">20.7 months of working capital</cite>, allowing for sustained long-term planning. The organization's ability to generate <cite id="3">$30,000,000 in funds invested and leveraged</cite> highlights its effectiveness in building partnerships and expanding its influence within the cultural sector.
rich_narrative.summary: Pillars Fund is a nonprofit organization dedicated to strengthening relations between American Muslims and the broader public by amplifying Muslim talents and leadership. The organization focuses on reshaping cultural narratives through strategic investments in storytelling and media. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported <cite id="1">$2,398,957 in total revenue</cite>. Pillars Fund demonstrates a strong commitment to its mission, directing a <cite id="2">74.3% program expense ratio</cite> toward its core initiatives. The organization has achieved significant scale in its impact, with <cite id="3">$30,000,000 in funds invested and leveraged</cite> to support its programs. Through initiatives like the Pillars Artist Fellowship, the organization has successfully provided resources to creators, including <cite id="4">6 Fellows supported in its MNC cohort</cite> and the production of <cite id="5">6 multimedia contributions</cite>. The organization maintains robust financial health with <cite id="6">20.7 months of working capital</cite> available to sustain operations, though it faces challenges with a <cite id="7">-53.4% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite> and a fundraising efficiency of <cite id="8">$0.31 per $1 raised</cite>. Governance is overseen by <cite id="9">9 board members</cite>, ensuring strategic oversight of its capacity-building delivery model.
